page.title: 15HESSLE LIBRARY
page.content: The library, opened in 1984, is situated on the corner of Swinegate and Southgate. It houses the Careers Centre and the library itself and is open five days a week. The library is run by Humberside Leisure Services and provides facilities for photocopying, tourist information, a reference section and community information. The borrowing library is divided into three sections - fiction, non-fiction and children's books. There is an additional section with large print books for people with poor eyesight. Any one person can borrow up to 5 books of which there 28,360 covering a wide range of subjects. Between 800 and 1,000 books are borrowed every day. In addition to books, national and international maps may be borrowed though the books in the reference library can only be used inside.
